overview_of_class: Turkish 111-2 is the second part of a three-quarter introductory course in modern Turkish. It is open to both undergraduate and graduate students.
name: Turkish I
title: WCAS TURKISH 111-2-20 Turkish I

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Turkish 111-2 is the second part of a three-quarter introductory course in modern Turkish. It is open to both undergraduate and graduate students.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Successful completion of Turkish 111-1 or equivalent is required.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: This course aims to introduce students to the essential points of modern Turkish grammar and vocabulary to develop basic reading, writing, speaking and listening skills. The course also provides insights into modern Turkish culture through the language.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Lectures on grammar, listening exercises, and homework assignments are based on Kurtulu? Öztopçu's Elementary Turkish: A Complete Course for Beginners. Revised Third Edition. The two-volume textbook can be purchased online at http://www.elementaryturkish.com/buy/. The textbook is supplemented by additional printed and audio-visual materials provided by the instructor.

subject: TURKISH
